meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: Telecommunications (Method for Determining Spectrum Utilization Fee) (Spectrum for Auction) Regulation

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: application period (申請限期) means a period after which the Authority may not, in accordance with the specified terms, accept written applications for participating in an auction;
auction (拍賣) means an auction or a series of auctions referred to in section 3;
bidder (競投人) includes a person who has, by written application to the Authority, expressed an intention to participate in an auction;

def.name: EligibleBidder
def.leadIn: eligible bidder (合資格競投人) means a bidder that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been determined by the Authority in accordance with the specified terms to be qualified to participate in an auction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been determined by the Authority in accordance with the specified terms to be disqualified from participating in the auction;

section.def: frequency band (頻帶) includes a division of a frequency band referred to in section 4;
specified terms (指明條款) means the terms and conditions of an auction specified under section 11(b);
spectrum (頻譜) means the spectrum referred to in section 3.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Determining spectrum utilization fee by auction

subsection.content: The spectrum utilization fee for using the spectrum that falls within a frequency band set out in the Schedule is to be determined by an auction or a series of auctions held in accordance with this Regulation and the specified terms.
This section is subject to sections 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 8A and 9. (L.N. 53 of 2024)
For determining the spectrum utilization fee, the Authority may further divide a frequency band set out in the Schedule for an auction.
A division of a frequency band under subsection (1) is to be specified in the specified terms.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Spectrum utilization fee payable if there is more than one eligible bidder

subsection.content: If, on the expiry of the application period for participating in an auction, there is more than one eligible bidder, the auction is to be held for determining the spectrum utilization fee for using the spectrum concerned.
The amount of the spectrum utilization fee is the amount payable by the successful bidder as determined by the outcome of the auction.
However, the amount payable must not be less than the minimum amount of the spectrum utilization fee specified under section 10 for the spectrum concerned.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Spectrum utilization fee payable if there is only 1 eligible bidder

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the expiry of the application period for participating in an auction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the start of the auction,

subsection.continued: there is only 1 eligible bidder, the auction is not to be held for determining the spectrum utilization fee for using the spectrum concerned.

subsection.content: The amount of the spectrum utilization fee is the minimum amount of the spectrum utilization fee specified under section 10 for the spectrum concerned.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Spectrum utilization fee payable if connected bidders are involved

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 2 or more successful bidders in an auction are connected bidders;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total amount of the spectrum successfully bidden by those bidders exceeds the spectrum cap; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Authority conducts another auction for those bidders in accordance with the specified terms.

subsection.content: The amount of a bid made by the successful bidder in the other auction is to be added to, and form part of, the spectrum utilization fee payable by that bidder for using the spectrum concerned.
The amount of a bid in the other auction must not be less than the minimum amount of the spectrum utilization fee specified under section 10 for the spectrum concerned.

subsection.def: connected bidder (有關連的競投人) has the same meaning as in the specified terms;
spectrum cap (頻譜上限) means the maximum amount of the spectrum specified by the Authority in the specified terms that may be assigned to a group of persons who are connected bidders.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Spectrum utilization fee not payable for use of spectrum relating to space object

subsection.content: If a user of the spectrum that falls within the frequency band 3400–3600 MHz is authorized by the Authority to use the spectrum for the sole purpose of telemetry, tracking, control, monitoring and testing functions related to the use, maintenance, operation and control of space objects, the user is not liable to pay any spectrum utilization fee for using the spectrum solely for that purpose.

subsection.def: space object (空間物體) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Outer Space Ordinance (Cap. 523).

section.name: s8A
section.heading: Spectrum utilization fee not payable for use of spectrum relating to mobile telecommunications services within designated area or cross-border railways

subsection.content: No spectrum utilization fee is payable for the use of the spectrum that falls within the frequency bands 885–890 MHz and 930–935 MHz if the user of the spectrum is authorized by the Authority to use the spectrum through a base station located in a designated area solely for providing mobile telecommunications services within a designated area.

No spectrum utilization fee is payable for the use of the spectrum that falls within the frequency bands 885–889 MHz and 930–934 MHz if the user of the spectrum is authorized by the Authority to use the spectrum solely for communication and control in relation to the operation of cross-border railways between Hong Kong and any place outside Hong Kong.
The Authority may specify an area to be a designated area for the purposes of subsection (1).
The Authority must publish the details of the specification of the designated area in the Gazette.

This section does not apply in relation to the use of spectrum if section 3A of the Telecommunications (Determining Spectrum Utilization Fees by Auction) Regulation (Cap. 106 sub. leg. AC) applies in relation to such use.

subsection.def: base station (基地電台) means a transmitting and receiving station built on land for the provision of mobile telecommunications services.

subsection.leadIn: The spectrum utilization fee determined under this Regulation must be paid—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: annually in instalments in accordance with subsections (1A) and (2). (L.N. 68 of 2025)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: For subsection (1)(b), the number of instalments is to be equal to the number of years that the spectrum utilization fee covers for the use of the spectrum concerned (specified number of years). (L.N. 68 of 2025)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: For determining the specified number of years, part of a year is to be regarded as a year. (L.N. 68 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(b), the spectrum utilization fee for each instalment is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the first instalment—an amount equal to the lump sum referred to in subsection (1)(a) divided by the specified number of years; (L.N. 68 of 2025)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for each subsequent instalment—an amount equal to the spectrum utilization fee payable in the immediately preceding instalment increased by— (L.N. 60 of 2021)

subparagraph.content: for a spectrum that falls within a frequency band set out in Part 2 of the Schedule—2%; (L.N. 60 of 2021; L.N. 53 of 2024)
for a spectrum that falls within a frequency band set out in Part 3 of the Schedule—2.5%; (L.N. 53 of 2024; L.N. 68 of 2025)
for a spectrum that falls within a frequency band set out in Part 4 of the Schedule—2.5%; or (L.N. 53 of 2024; L.N. 68 of 2025)
for a spectrum that falls within a frequency band set out in Part 5 of the Schedule—2.5%. (L.N. 68 of 2025)

subsection.content: The spectrum utilization fee is payable at the time and in the way required by the Authority.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Secretary may specify minimum amount of spectrum utilization fee
section.leadIn: The Secretary may specify the minimum amount of the spectrum utilization fee for the purposes of sections 5(3), 6(2) and 7(3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by notice published in the Gazette or in any other manner; and

subparagraph.content: a minimum fee determined by reference to a formula or percentage or the occurrence of an event or a series of events;
a series of 2 or more minimum fees in relation to the same spectrum utilization fee where the relevant minimum fee is determined by reference to the occurrence of an event or a series of events;
a minimum fee the determination of which varies on the occurrence of an event or a series of events;
a minimum fee determined by reference to another minimum fee, or by reference to the means of determining another minimum fee, whether or not the other minimum fee is or will become payable;
a minimum fee the determination of which varies with, or is calculated by reference to, the period of validity of a licence or a part of the period; or
a combination of 2 or more of any of the means specified in subparagraph (i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v) or (vi), whether in whole or in part.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Authority may hold auction etc. and specify terms and conditions of auction

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: promote, hold, conduct, suspend, cancel or conclude an auction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice published in the Gazette, specify the terms and conditions of an auction (including the terms and conditions relating to the payment of the spectrum utilization fee).
